Vowels.description: A short vowel sound, similar to 'a' in 'ago'.
A long vowel sound, similar to 'a' in 'father'.
A short vowel sound, similar to 'i' in 'bit'.
A long vowel sound, similar to 'ee' in 'see'.
A short vowel sound, similar to 'u' in 'put'.
A long vowel sound, similar to 'oo' in 'food'.
A vowel sound similar to the 'ri' in 'riddle' but rolled slightly, used mainly in Sanskrit-derived words.
A vowel sound similar to 'ay' in 'say'.
A diphthong similar to 'eye' in 'kite'. (A combintion of the 'ah' sound plus the 'ee' sound).
A vowel sound similar to 'o' in 'go'.
A nasalized vowel sound, often transliterated as 'am' or 'an'. It's made by expelling air through the nose.
A visarga sound, like a soft echoing 'h', often appearing at the end of Sanskrit-origin words.

Velar.description: A velar consonant, similar to 'k' in 'kite'.
An aspirated velar consonant, like 'k' in 'khaki' with extra breath.
A voiced velar consonant, similar to 'g' in 'go'.
An aspirated voiced velar consonant, like 'g' with more breath.
A velar nasal sound, similar to 'ng' in 'sing'.

Palatal.description: A palatal consonant, similar to 'ch' in 'chat'.
An aspirated palatal consonant, pronounced like 'ch' in 'church' with more air.
A voiced palatal consonant, similar to 'j' in 'jam'.
An aspirated palatal consonant, pronounced like 'j' but with more breath.
A palatal nasal sound, sort of pronounced like 'nee-yunh'.

Retroflex.description: A retroflex consonant with the tongue curled back, like the 't' in 'taper'.
An aspirated retroflex consonant, pronounced like 't' with more breath.
A voiced retroflex consonant pronounced with a curled tongue, like the 'd' in 'dote'.
An aspirated voiced retroflex consonant, pronounced like 'd' with more breath.
A retroflex nasal sound, pronounced with the tongue curled back. No English equivalent.

Dental.description: A dental consonant, pronounced with the tongue touching the teeth. Similar to the 'th' in 'thorn'.
An aspirated dental consonant, pronounced with breath. Similar to 'th' with more breath.
A voiced dental consonant. Like the 'th' in 'the', but pressing the tongue into the roof of the mouth for longer.
An aspirated voiced dental consonant. Similar to the 'th' in 'the' with more breath.
A dental nasal consonant, like to 'n' in 'net'.

Labial.description: A labial consonant, similar to 'p' in 'pen'.
An aspirated labial consonant, pronounced like 'p' more breath; not the same as 'f'.
A voiced labial consonant, similar to 'b' in 'bat'.
An aspirated voiced labial consonant, like 'b' with more breath.
A labial nasal sound, like the 'm' in 'man'.

Approximants & Sibilants.description: A palatal approximant, similar to 'y' in 'yes'.
A lateral consonant, similar to 'l' in 'love'.
A palatal sibilant, similar to 'sh' in 'shoe'.
A retroflex sibilant, pronounced like a harder 'sh'.
A dental sibilant, similar to 's' in 'sun'.
A glottal consonant, like the 'h' in 'hat'.

Additional Sounds.description: A compound consonant pronounced similar to the 'ctio' when Drake says 'function' in Nokia.
A compound consonant often pronounced like 'gya' or 'dnya'.
